Protein sources can be found in a wide variety of plant and animal foods. Meat, eggs, milk and fish are complete sources. Among the main vegetables rich in protein are the vegetables, especially beans, lentils, soybeans and chickpeas. Most amino acids are available in human food, but special situations, such as bariatric surgery, require supplementation. When the body does not receive the necessary amounts of protein, there is protein insufficiency and malnutrition, which can lead to a number of diseases, including kwashiorkor, alopecia and intense muscular loss
